creator: Jay.Herrick@XSVoice.com
text:
If you specify an <error-page> tag in your web.xml and the file that is defined in the <location> 
tag is missing or misnamed, the tomcat server will throw itself into a recursive loop that crashes 
the server in a few seconds.  It appears that tomcat tries to render the 404 page for the missing 
404 page... and so on and so forth.

For me, the recursive loop only happened if the missing error page was a JSP.

This has been fixed in Tomcat 3.2.3 and Tomcat 3.3 post Milestone 4.  The
updated behavior currently results in no response output if a recursive call
to the error handler is made.  You will have to look in the log output to see
the error.
